Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cnd F1W (Chionodracine analog, synthetic AMPs, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (95.45%) toChionodracineG: 18%, V=L=H: 14%.Activity: active against K. pneumoniae KPC (MIC 10.0-21.0 uM), ESBL E. coli (MIC 5.2-10.3 uM), XDR A. baumannii (MIC 5.2-10.3 uM), MDR P. aeruginosa (MIC 10.3-20.6 uM), S. aureus MRSA (MIC 20.6-41.2 uM), S. epidermidis (MIC 5.2-10.3 uM), and E. faecalis anti-VRE (MIC 5.2-10.3 uM). In total, 70 clinical strains were tested and the results are expressed as a range.Structure:  random coil in PBS buffer and helical in POPC (1-Palmitoyl-2-oleoyl-sn-glycero-3-phosphocholine) LUVs ((Large Unilamellar Vesicles).
Literature Information.Author: Olivieri C, Bugli F, Menchinelli G, Veglia G, Buonocore F, Scapigliati G, Stocchi V, Ceccacci F, Papi M, Sanguinetti M, Porcelli F. 2018
Literature Information.Title: Design and characterization of chionodracine-derived antimicrobial peptides with enhanced activity against drug-resistant human pathogens.
